result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovanni L. Mora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for 180 days served if revoked.  Probation may be transferred to Illinois.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
May not have contact with Erna Schneider, Rosa Lopez, or Fernando or Miguel Poblete, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions.  Conditions include no contact with the co-defendants, with victim E.S. and also R.L  Credit for 180 days served if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
